channel.title: Stan for cognitive science
channel.description: Recent content on Stan for cognitive science

item.title: Books and tutorials using Stan
item.description: Books Bayesian Cognitive Modeling: A Practical Course (2014) by Michael Lee and Eric-Jan Wagenmakers. Stan code available Doing Bayesian Data Analysis: A Tutorial with R, JAGS, and Stan (2014) by John Kruschke Statistical rethinking: A Bayesian course with examples in R and Stan (2020) by Richard McElreath An Introduction to Bayesian Data Analysis for Cognitive Science (in progress) by Bruno Nicenboim, Daniel Schad, and Shravan Vasishth Courses Handouts Mark Lai’s course handouts for PSYC 621 class

item.title: Papers using Stan
item.description: Papers using Stan (or brms, rstanarm) 2020 Avetisyan, S., S. Lago, and S. Vasishth. “Does case marking affect agreement attraction in comprehension?” In: Journal of Memory and Language 112 (2020). DOI: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jml.2020.104087. Bürki, A., S. Elbuy, S. Madec, and S. Vasishth. “What did we learn from forty years of research on semantic interference? A Bayesian meta-analysis”. In: Journal of Memory and Language (2020). DOI: 10.1016/j.jml.2020.104125. Bürkner, P.
